text: José Julián Martí Pérez (January 28, 1853 – May 19, 1895) was a Cuban patriot, freedom fighter and poet. Although he never lived to see Cuba free, he is considered the national hero. == Biography == Jose Marti was born in Havana in 1853.Ronning, C. Neal José Martí and the Émigré colony in Key West: Leadership and State Formation Praeger Publishers One Madison Avenue New York, New York 1990 page 8 At age sixteen he was imprisoned for opposing Spanish colonial rule during the Ten Years War (1868-1878) and later he was exiled to Spain.Quiroz, Alfonso W. The Cuban Republic and Jose Marti: Reception and Use of a National Symbol Lexington Books 2006 page 2 There he published a pamphlet exposing the horrors of political imprisonment in Cuba, which he himself had experienced. In 1878 he returned to Cuba under a general amnesty and worked for a law firm,Rodríguez-Luis, Julio Re-reading José Martí (1853-1895): One Hundred Years Later (1999) State University of New York Press Albany page 143 but he conspired against the Spanish authorities and again was banished to Spain in September 1879. He fled exile in Spain and came first to France and then to the United States. Marti went back to New York where he lived from 1881 to 1895. ==References== Category:1853 births Category:1895 deaths Category:Cuban politicians Category:People from Havana
